pros: Good pay for what you do. Good coworkers.
cons: ICU admissions are typically low acuity patients that would belong on a stepdown unit. Poor unit based management. Policies change based on if you are on good terms or poor terms with management. Weekend scheduling is rigidly inflexible. If you are a new graduate nurse you work every other weekend the first two years, followed by every third weekend for a long time. If you call out for a scheduled weekend you have one schedule period to "make up" your weekend call out. This company preaches work life balance, but does not actually support it. If you do not communicate when you would like your "make up" weekend to occur, they will schedule it for you wherever they would like.

pros:
Pay is decent but not great.
Love my team members.
PTO & benefits are a big plus (except that you have to use your PTO for the “paid holidays“) 
They don’t pay for your holidays you do!
cons:
I have worked for CC for over 14 years now. 5 years ago if you had asked about my job and my boss I would have said I loved it! I recently went through a rough patch in my personal life during COVID and the leader of my department took it as a “personal inconvenience” and quite literally turned on me. 
Very Toxic & Vindictive Leadership 
The toxic leaders are “untouchable”. The overturn in the department the past few years has been astounding, yet no one cares to find out why. Like I said, toxic leadership is simply allowed to happen, and there is no real recourse for the employee when they are treated badly, or when they are personally being treated like trash!! Excellence & Love are just words if you don’t follow them.

review_title: Needs to listen to staff & make meaningful change
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Wilmington, DE
pros: Benefits are pretty good, as they should be for a healthcare system.
cons:
Pay for RNs as compared to tri state is lagging behind significantly to the tune of $6-7 difference in base rate & those with experience are making around the same as new hires. No increases in pay for working a specialty or with higher acuity patients (ICU & Stepdown). 

No work life balance for nurses (speaking on this because it’s what’s I know & I can’t speak for other departments). Getting time off when you want it can be challenging. 

Paid holidays actually are paid for by you, from your PTO bank instead of by the hospital which contributes to depleting your bank & if you don’t want to use PTO you have to work the holiday or sometime that week (so not really a paid holiday). 

Upper management fails to adequately address & speak on safety concerns (staffing, workload, ratios), adequate pay, and other areas of concern staff has brought to their attention. 

I feel Christiana takes advantage of their workers in that they are the largest system in Delaware, so they don’t pay us as fairly as surrounding states. At this point change is so slow moving (or not moving) that many are considering leaving or actively looking to leave, which will only contribute to the short staffing already existing. Many have already left for better pay and work life balance opportunities.

pros: Good and affordable benefits, decent equipment
cons: Low pay, short staffed, no work life balance

CPOE since 2010. Diverse patient population.
cons:
Performance reviews are not based on job descriptions. Randomly decided by management at Christiana.Criteria changes every year at time of evaluation,  so it makes it impossible for employee to know expectations for "Role Model"
Performance reviews are completed in May and employees are not informed of status/raise until July.
Management does not promote within.
Management employess  newest graduates with zero working experience at the expense of promoting seasoned competent dedicated employess even demoting experienced employees to make a position available for a new grad.
Too many scheduled times to report to work during any given  day (ie.. 0600,0700,0800,1000,1300,12:30) which makes for a frustrating schedule. (always need to check schedule for time to come in)
Limited professional growth for current staff.
Top and middle management heavy.
Management recognizes tardiness (>1minute late) but does not applaud over time, extra shifts, or extra workload days
CCHS is the biggest health care employer in the state and take advantage of the fact that they are " the only game in town".

review_title: Serving the needs of the community
job_title: Medical Laboratory Scientist in Newark, DE
pros: Values and Behaviors - Serving Together with Love and Excellence
cons: Not enough people resources to deliver its mission

pros: Medical Benefits and Cost of them
cons: Inconsistent Compensation packages. Salary ranges overlap terribly

job_title: Certified Family Nurse Practitioner in Wilmington, DE
pros:
-Benefits
-Nursing clinical ladder 
-Nursing resources
-Work/life balance
cons: -Frequent calls offering to pick up shifts

pros: Close to surrounding cities like philly
cons: Having to commute down I-95

pros: Competitive pay, friendly staff, flexible hours
cons: Out dated processes, fluid policies and procedures

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Newark, DE
pros: Good pay, great staff relationships
cons: Terrible patient to staff ratio

job_title: Procedural Area Technician in Newark, DE
pros: They took all the good things that came with this job away.
cons: Pay vs job duties is unreasonable

pros: Career development, appropriate resources, updated
cons: Very strict and political, everything is placed on nursing, short staffed, not valued

pros: Having autonomy to help patients in their home setting
cons: Management and supervisors are incompetent. They are not out in the field but think they know how to manage those that are which results in poor morale. Field staff are making the money for the organization as we are providing services and care.  Very poor orientation and education for new employees. Always understaffed and all supervisors want is nurses to see more patients and do not have concern for patient safety or employee life work balance.  Never see a supervisor step out of office to try to help in the field. Management does not realize employee turnover has something to do with poor management!

review_title: Very stuffy and invasive company with policies that apply to everyone.
pros: Good benefits, decent pay, pays for AAPC membership and provides CEU webinars
cons: Very stuffy culture, encourages you to just do your job (don't go above and beyond), policies apply to everyone across the board. Required to take education seminars for clinical information that didn't apply to my job. My biggest problem: very limited flexibility with schedule. Billing is subject to the same rules as nurses and that is not OK with me. I understand why nurses have limited flexibility, they work in shifts. No one comes in when I leave and does my work for me though, so flexibility is a perk that I feel like I have earned.

pros: This is an incredible organization to work for.  The benefits are outstanding and the medical expertise is outstanding.  I work in the OB/GYN area.  They are constantly looking for ways to improve patient care and safety by constantly performing data evaluation
cons: The only cons I truly see about this organization is the lack of parking for employees and the lower levels of pay for non-medical staff.  This is to be expected when working for a non-profit organization such as health care

pros: Great Benefits, Great 403B plan, room for advancement, decent wages, teamwork, local community active, very good hospital system offering many services to DE and the TriState area.
cons: No Flex hours.  The "7" minute rule on signing in to start work doesn't apply to benefit the employee. The employee can sign in 7 minutes prior to the start of work; however, if the employee is 1 minute late, it activates an accurance to go on employee record. Streamlining staff to stay within "The Budget".  Work-Life Balance is not as healthy as advertised.  Work outweighs personal life.

job_title: Emergency Care Technician in Newark, DE
pros: My coworkers are amazing. Benefits can be great - paid time off rolls over year to year, can be cashed out in 20, 40, or 60 hr chunks, and increases with seniority. I have been with CCHS for 14 yrs and earn 7 wks paid time off each year. 50% matching contribution to 403B, tuition reimbursement.
cons: Management is  not always "present" but holds employees to sometimes unrealistic expectations, health insurance is decent, not great.  Because of its size, there is a large volume of patients coming and going and safety and security of patients, visitors and staff could be greater.

review_title: Working at Christiana Hospital is a learning experience.
pros: It's a large teaching hospital with many resources.  Hospitalists are in house 24/7 so getting orders for things the patients need is faster than getting call backs from private healthcare providers.  The rooms have ceiling mounted lifts which is great for both staff and patient safety.  They have an onsite RN-BSN program and internships for nurses interested in the MICU, ED, NICU, and OR.  Scheduling is flexible for the most part.  Parking is free.  The campus is smokefree.
cons: I don't feel like I have an advocate within my unit's management.

review_title: I regret wasting time and effort without praise, appreciation and honesty.
pros: Benefits and compensation are above average.  That's the lure to work here.
cons: Some of my coworkers in and out of management are not very competent.  Upper management practices hypocrisy on a daily basis. Don't be a scapegoat. You will be happier elsewhere.

review_title: My dream job turned out to be a nightmare.
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Christiana, DE
pros:
Largest and highest rated hospital in Delaware
Many wonderful employees who do a great job
Great pay
Great location
Excellent reputation
Loved my job, learned new skills, and fulfilled my dream of helping patients.
cons:
Horrible supervisor and staff. I was not given job description nor orientation checklist until I requested them.
Inconsistent and practically non-existent orientation.

I was told not to ask questions and not to talk to patients.
I was placed under extreme scrutiny and bullied by staff in front of patients.
I was written up for everything and anything though nursing practices were inconsistent among staff.

On one such occasion,  I was told by a nurse that I did something wrong.  I explained to her that the last time I performed the task, I was advised to do it this way (but not by whom). I also told her that I would not have chosen to do it that way.  The nurse brought out the supervisor and proceeded to have a discussion with all the nurses, in front of the patients,in which they concluded:

 1. Who told me to do it that way 
 2. Each nurse had their own way of doing it 
 3. The task should not be done at all.

 I was not included in the discussion. I was taking care of patients.

No support received from department manager though manager was aware of the supervisor's determination to terminate me. He recommended that I fight to keep my job.

I was determined not to quit, but as a last resort decided to contact employee relations when I was on my break. I was only able to leave a message.

I never received a return call and was terminated the next day by the supervisor and manager.  There was no HR representative present.

review_title: I'm happy to be here, but need to move to another department to Grow
job_title: Human Resources Representative in Newark, DE
pros:
The hospital and its employees really about their patients and their community
We are a technologically advanced hospital system and provide excellent care to our patients
We strive to be and ARE a Great Place to Work
cons:
Development in non-medical positions is slow and managers need to learn how to develop their people.  
People are too used to the status quo.  They tend to do things because "they always have" and not because it's the best way to do them

review_title: searching for respect and support at christiana care
pros: The monetary compensation surpasses any other acute care facility in delaware. Technologically they are comparable if not better then most facilities in the region.
cons: administration does not support the bedside nurses or promote shared decision making as they would like to believe. it seems they like to make you believe there is shared decision making when there really isn't. it still all boils down to what administration wants. After 4 1/2 years working there we were told we would no longer receive health benefits upon retiring. I was told upon being hired that this would be a benefit I would be receiving hence a good recruitment tool for me.

review_title: You could do worse than work at Christiana.
pros: It's a big company and there's a lot of stability in employment.
cons: There's is very little opportunity for growth or advancement, and little to no recognition for a job well done. I am consistently puzzled as to how the members of the management team were chosen.

review_title: My experience at Christiana Hospital is tolerable somewhat.
job_title: Service Assistant I in Newark, DE
pros: They have Medical & Dental insurance from Day 1, Credit Union, Tax Shelter Annuity plans, Pension plan, Cash out pay on hours.
cons: You're expected to work nights, weekends, holidays in some departments. Have to work on snow days. Work hours/shifts aren't always great. Have to ask co-workers to switch with you when day off is needed. Human Resources doesn't help employees much.

review_title: Grueling pace, inadequate support. Miss breaks most days. Management interaction negative
pros: Flexible scheduling. Better pay the parochial area hospitals but still below union salaries. Storeroom are well stocked with supplies. Safety lifting equipment is available
cons: A monster of HR beaurocrats who treat employees as numbers. A mind boggling performance system involving jumping through hoops and not slightly related to real world performance

review_title: Resident Physician who is actually happy in their job!
pros: Christiana Care is an excellent option for an Internal Medicine Residency. It is a large community hospital ideally located near Philadelphia & Baltimore. While it is not a University based hospital, it is the major trauma center for Delaware and has pretty much all the sub-specialties you need. It also is the major delivery hospital for Del with the majority of deliveries in Delaware taking place here. New fellowships are being formed each year with Nephrology & Cardiology being the current options.
cons: Not University based. Major area in need of improvement is in research, both bench and clinical.

pros:
Great environment and culture
Nice employees
Good employee benefits
cons: None from my experiences with this company

review_title: Save your time and go somewhere else
pros: There are some hard-working employees here.
cons:
Overall, they pretend to care for the employees, but they really do not. The HR is so inadequate during the onboarding process. The employee wellness is a joke, there are so many false positives in the tests you take. The Employee Wellness Center is terrible, long waiting times and understaffed. 
There are some good departments but not many. Overall, they all have the same atmosphere. The managers do not care much about their employees. Women are not empowered here at all. I will be reprimanded quickly if I say something that is different from what my manager wants. Save yourself and go somewhere else.

review_title: Good Place To work, if you start as a Sr. Analyst
pros: work life balance, deadlines are negotiable, management won't bother you. There are many internal opportunities to transfer to other roles
cons: If you come into the organization underpaid you will continue to be underpaid during your time at Christiana.  There is no mentor ship program and many of the senior people in IT have outdated skills and they are desperately trying to hang on to them.

review_title: Great benefits, Promotions happen depending on your floor manager
job_title: Patient Care Tech in Newark, DE
pros: Christiana has really good benefits; I found health insurance to be very reasonable, tuition assistance is offered. I enjoyed all the shift differentials I recieved working evenings and nights for overtime. There are also some great employees working there and you can have a lot of fun depending on the unit you are working. When you work holidays you are being paid time in a half which comes in handy! There is usually always overtime for those who desire it. I meant a lot of great people working there and saw many techs get promoted to nurses. Unfortunately for me majoring in psychology didn't allow me to have anywhere to get promoted too;but I did learn A LOT from caring for psych. patients. It is a great place for someone who is in nursing school to learn and practice skills. Although it only happens twice a year you will indeed see the president coming to every floor to shake hands; he doesn't talk to eveyone indivdually but I have seen him several times walking the hospital and he is actually accessible which is nice.
cons:
Managers: Some of them are rude and you have to "post-out" when trying to move to another unit and certain managers make it difficult to leave.

Bad Weather: when the weather is bad expect to come to work; even if you have kids at home the organization doesn't care about you; they only care about covering their staffing.

Being pulled/or sent home: It is a teaching hopsital and if your unit is overstaffed expect to be sent to other floors to work (this could be anywhere; and often nerve wrecking when other staff is nasty) or they will "cancel" you and make you use your PTO time to go home sometimes it is nice to go home when the units are really busy but other days it would be nice to keep your time.

It's a hospital and they do have the right to keep you for mandatory overtime when coverage is necessary; the chances of this happpening become very high when big snow and ice storms are expected. However, they did give us the next day off for staying so that was nice.

pros: Christiana Care is a great hospital system to work for. Feels like a community and they are trying to add more employee wellness programs to help people that help others daily.
cons: Depending on department or job position, may not be able to move up or progress unless you switch to a different department. Pay based on grant-funding can be poor.

pros: Great employee benefits, good location, free employee parking.
cons: Professional growth stagnant. Limited involvement between some middle management and staff.

review_title: Ok place to work.  Thinks it's a big league provider, but really it's just big Delaware
job_title: Senior Analyst in New Castle, DE
pros: Doing well financially.  Has a great stranglehold on care in Delaware and moving aggressively against competitors and into other nearby states.
cons: Bloated heirarchy in management with no real leadership.  Turnover is nonexistent where it should be, and high where it shouldn't

review_title: I obtained great experience at Christiana Care, but now I feel like I'm being held back & it's time for me to leave.
pros: I feel like my job is secure because of the size of company & future expansion plans.  They prepay tuition to select colleges and are flexible with your school schedule with unit based self scheduling, It's a large teaching hospital.
cons: politics, poor raises, not allowing me to renew my ACLS &  not being paid for my certification

job_title: Radiologic Technologist in New Castle, DE
pros: competitive pay. employees are friendly and knowledgeable
cons: Staff are treated like they are all replaceable, there is little to no "work life balance" management is not very helpful or knowledgeable. company is all about money and does not care about well being of employees

pros: The people are supportive and professional. Relationship between physicians, nurses, administrators is one of open communication for the most part. Dept. chairs seem genuinely involved and concerned in the work of their staff.
cons: Not connected with a major academic center. Primary care salaries are only fair.  Specialists are accessible but seem to be doing things that primary care docs do elsewhere.

review_title: I transported patients,medicine, and other products to different places.
pros: The best reason for working here is you have to love what you do. I personally love taking care of patients and I don't like to see patients hurt at all.
cons: Well some of the challenges are getting patients to OR for surgery on a stat call.

review_title: Great place to start and gain experience
job_title: Patient Information Representative in Newark, DE
pros: Tuition assistance, flexible for students, pay is higher then most entry level positions, increased communication and computer skills, yearly increase in pay, bonuses.
cons: Management is hard to find, under staffed in areas, hard remove bad employees, parking is hard to find, hospital inside appears dated, allowing visitors at anytime seems unsafe and rude to patients

review_title: Excellent Year as a Student Nurse Extern
pros: Working as a SNE while working on my nursing degree was perfect, the staff was extremely welcoming and answered my many questions. It was a great way to learn about the basics of patient care, as well as how to work well with an interdisciplinary team.
cons: The only problem I came across was trouble with staffing - there would often be too few nurses and far too few techs on the floor.

pros: As Delaware's largest system and level 1 trauma center you will gain a great deal of experience and knowledge. Competitive pay and benefits.   Caring and professional staff, patient safety is a priority.
cons: Constantly understaffed because of high turnover, very little work/life balance.  You will leave everyday exhausted.   Ineffective supervisors and management that can be unprofessional towards staff at times.  If you like micromanagement, this is the place for you.

review_title: Terrible management ruins quality of life
pros: Salary/benefits extremely competitive (I came for the salary)
cons: Management is terrible, I had a revolving door of supervisors who are not transparent and only look out for themselves. Politics between departments put patient and staff needs at risk. Technology infrastructure is outdated and senior management does not care, they just blame the frontline staff rather than improve things. Only people I met who practice the values of "Love and Excellence" were frontline clinical and tech staff. Director-level and supervisors only care about the bottom line and doing as little as possible, while looking to spread blame around as a distraction. Would never work here again.

review_title: Depends on your specific department or speciality.
job_title: Clinical Social Worker in Wilmington, DE
pros: Management seems to take an interest in employee input.  Patient care is generally put first.  Pay and benefits are reasonable.
cons: Benefits and pay max quickly depending on job title.  I have not had good experience or responsiveness to requests for help with career development which they advertise as offered.  Some departments have very poor managers and non-patient care positions with top pay and benefits seem abundent.

review_title: One of the better places to work.
pros: Great personal time off, benefits, and pay.  Good experience working with people from all backgrounds and experience levels.
cons: Depending on your job class - limited mobility.  People like it there so they dont create openings by leaving.

job_title: Senior Medical Coder in Newark, DE
pros: Plenty of resource for CEUS,  ability to flex and good pto.  Coworkers are pleasant to work with and stand together.  Ability to work from home
cons: Management is quick to blame and reprimand employees for simple mistakes and make them feel bad about asking for guidance.   In the HIM department advancement opportunities are few and far between and increases in pay are mediocre at best.

pros: Physicians and practitioners excellent to work with, company provides good benefits.  Great learning experience with multitude of procedures performed providing great service to community
cons: Ineffective management, very inappropriate bully style supervision in this department.  No shared decision making, and lacks patient centered care.  Poor work life balance in this department

job_title: Student Nurse Extern in Wilmington, DE
pros: No matter what unit you work on, the staff will always reach out to help you. It is an education friendly environment; I've never been denied a chance to learn from an experience.
cons: Absolutely none! They work with you to schedule you every other weekend (being a nursing student is tough on its own, they understand that)

review_title: It is what you make it to be!
job_title: Senior Biomedical Equipment Technician in Newark, DE
pros: Compensation, flexibility, benefits, location, shuttle in between campuses
cons: Co-workers who are more concerned about what I do, as opposed to the job they are supposed to be doing. Management who turns a blind eye to the tension within the department. Co-workers who talk a good game, but have no clue of what they are doing.

job_title: Document Imaging Specialist in Wilmington, DE
pros: Great benefits and seminars. If you focus on your job and your involvement with the team you will prosper.
cons: The pay should be better for the amount of time and all tge adjustments made to accommodate the organization.

review_title: Too many non-nursing duties placed on the nurses
pros: Good benefits, great opportunities for career advancement, lots of opportunity to make extra money
cons: No work/life balance, jobs within the system are very competitive, rotating schedules, nurses are responsible EVERYTHING not just caring for their patients, which affects their time with the patients

review_title: Open to improvement and listens to employees.  Cares about providing quality to the consumer, who are its neighbors.
pros: There is a great work life balance, flexible schedule, lots of vacation time.
cons: The location is not the best, but is close to major cities.  If you are looking for a surburban area, this is it.

pros: Excellent working relationship with DFES (the providers), nurses empowered to have a clinical voice.
cons: A lot of ancillary staff are not held accountable for their responsibilities (cleaning rooms, vital signs, answering call bells) and the nurses wear a LOT of hats.

job_title: Executive Director RN I in Newark, DE
pros: 6 months of preceptorship with ACLS, TNCC, and PALS certification built in, free parking, friendly boss who cares about work-life balance, many initiatives and committees to improve the flow of patient care
cons: When there's no incentive pay, nurse-patient ratios can suffer

pros: I worked with great physicians, who taught and encouraged my autonomy, but were always available for questions.
cons: I was commuting an hour each way. I didn't get along with one of my coworkers, who made the job less than ideal
